name: Spiced Egg Curry
author: Tarama
summary: Onions, garlic, ginger, and tomatoes with a hit of spices and egg. A very south Indian curry, and easy to make. You can make sandwiches or stuff the curry in roti and pita, or eat it with rice and yogurt.
directions: Heat oil in a pan over medium heat
Add ginger and curry leaves; cook and stir until flavor is released, 3 to 5 minutes
Place onions into the pan containing the ginger mixture; cook until the onions are translucent, 3 to 4 minutes
Add garlic paste; cook until garlic releases aroma, 3 to 4 minutes
Pour chili powder, coriander powder, turmeric powder, and salt into the onion mixture
Cook and stir, being careful not to burn the spices, until spices are incorporated, about 2 minutes
Stir tomatoes and tomato paste into the pan; cook and stir until the tomatoes are soft, about 5 minutes
Add boiled eggs to the pan; stir until eggs are coated, about 1 minute
